item.title: Tech talks
item.description: Links to my talks: 2019 Android Summit - August 2019, McLean, VA - “Reactive approach to delegation in Kotlin”. Links to slides and video. GDG DevFest - November 2019, Sydney, Australia - “Reactive approach to delegation in Kotlin”. Slides are available. Droidcon SF - November 2019, San Francisco, Ca - “Reactive approach to delegation in Kotlin”(slides) and “Level up your extension game”(slides)

item.title: Good and sad examples of extension functions
item.description: This article is based off my talk at Droidcon SF this year. Kotlin is well-known for null-safety and extension functions features among android developers. Extension functions provide the ability to make new functionality of an extending class without making changes to it. In addition, the new functionality can be declared outside of the extending class. They're also very beneficial when you want to tweak an api that can't be modified.

item.title: About me
item.description: Android developer with a full-time job at a company that pays me salary. Sometimes I come out of the comfort zone and give tech talks, and when I'm not lazy I write blog posts about android development on this website.
